{"step_by_step_thinking": "First pass metabolism refers to the liver's ability to metabolize drugs before they enter the systemic circulation. This is most prominent when drugs are administered orally, as they are absorbed from the gastrointestinal tract and transported to the liver via the hepatic portal vein. Intravenous, sublingual, and intradermal routes bypass the liver and thus avoid first-pass metabolism.", "answer_choice": "A"}
